import re
import pyspark.sql.functions as F
import pyspark.sql.types as T
from pyspark.ml.feature import StringIndexer, OneHotEncoder

[docs]class Filter(object):
    """
    Filters the data based on the rules parameter

    Args:
        df (spark.DataFrame)
        column_name (str)
        filter_rules (list)
        rule_expression (str)
    """
    def __init__(self, df, column_name, filter_rules, rule_expression):
        self.df = df
        self.column_name = column_name
        self.filter_rules = filter_rules
        self.rule_expression = rule_expression
        self.filter_operators = {
            1: "in",
            2: "not in",
            3: "==",
            4: ">",
            5: "<",
            6: ">=",
            7: "<=",
        }


[docs]    def execute(self):
        self._execute()
        return self.df


    def _execute(self):
        """ """
        rules = {}
        if self.column_name in self.df.columns:
            for rule in self.filter_rules:
                if rule["operator"] > 2:
                    if len(rule["allowed_values"]) == 1:
                        rule["allowed_values"] = rule["allowed_values"][0]

                    # ToDo - addition of parenthesis should be more pythonic
                    rule_value = [
                        "(",
                        "F.col('{}')".format(self.column_name),
                        self.filter_operators[rule["operator"]],
                        rule["allowed_values"],
                        ")",
                    ]
                    rules[rule["name"]] = " ".join(str(ele) for ele in rule_value)
                else:
                    rules[rule["name"]] = "(F.col('{0}').isin(*{1}))".format(
                        self.column_name, list(rule["allowed_values"])
                    )
                    if rule["operator"] == 2:
                        rules[rule["name"]] = "~" + rules[rule["name"]]

                self.rule_expression = self.rule_expression.replace("or", "|").replace("and", "&")

                for rule_id in rules:
                    self.rule_expression = re.sub(r"\b%s\b" % rule_id, rules[rule_id], self.rule_expression)

                self.rule_expression = (
                    self.rule_expression.replace("{", "").replace("}", "").replace("[", "(").replace("]", ")")
                )
                self.df = self.df.filter(eval(self.rule_expression))

            return self.df

        else:
            raise Exception("The {} is missing from the dataset.".format(self.column_name))




[docs]class NumTransforms(object):
    """
    encloses all the numerical transforms
    """


[docs]    @staticmethod
    def zscore(df, col_name, **kwargs):
        """
        calculates the z-score 

        Args:
            df (PySpark DataFrame)
            col_name (string): column name

        Raises:
            exceptions.IncorrectDataTypeError: raised when datatype is not numeric

        Returns:
            PySpark DataFrame
        """
        # unpacking keyword args
        col_rename = kwargs.get("output_column_name", "{}_zscore".format(col_name))
        retain_original = kwargs.get("retain_original", True)

        if not isinstance(df.schema[col_name].dataType, (
            T.ByteType,
            T.ShortType,
            T.IntegerType,
            T.DoubleType,
            T.FloatType,
            T.LongType
        )):
            raise Exception(
                "Column {0} must be of type numeric but was actually of type {1}".format(
                    col_name, df.schema[col_name].dataType
                )
            )

        mean_ = df.select(F.mean(col_name)).collect()[0][0]
        stddev_ = df.select(F.stddev(col_name)).collect()[0][0]
        df = df.withColumn(col_rename, (F.col(col_name) - mean_) / stddev_)

        if not retain_original:
            df = df.drop(*[col_name])

        return df



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def exp(df, col_name, **kwargs):
        """
        camputes the exponential of given column

        Args:
            df (PySpark DataFrame)
            col_name (string): column name

        Raises:
            exceptions.IncorrectDataTypeError: raised when datatype is not numeric

        Returns:
            PySpark DataFrame
        """
        # unpacking keyword args
        col_rename = kwargs.get("output_column_name", "{}_exp".format(col_name))
        retain_original = kwargs.get("retain_original", True)

        if not isinstance(df.schema[col_name].dataType, (
            T.ByteType,
            T.ShortType,
            T.IntegerType,
            T.DoubleType,
            T.FloatType,
            T.LongType
        )):
            raise Exception(
                "Column {0} must be of type numeric but was actually of type {1}".format(
                    col_name, df.schema[col_name].dataType
                )
            )

        df = df.withColumn(col_rename, F.exp(F.col(col_name)))

        if not retain_original:
            df = df.drop(*[col_name])

        return df



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def log(df, col_name, **kwargs):
        """
        computes logarithm (natural)

        Args:
            df (PySpark DataFrame)
            col_name (string): column name

        Raises:
            exceptions.IncorrectDataTypeError: raised when datatype is not numeric
            ValueError: raised if negative values or zero is encountered

        Returns:
            PySpark DataFrame
        """
        # unpacking keyword args
        col_rename = kwargs.get("output_column_name", "{}_exp".format(col_name))
        retain_original = kwargs.get("retain_original", True)

        if not isinstance(df.schema[col_name].dataType, (
            T.ByteType,
            T.ShortType,
            T.IntegerType,
            T.DoubleType,
            T.FloatType,
            T.LongType
        )):
            raise Exception(
                "Column {0} must be of type numeric but was actually of type {1}".format(
                    col_name, df.schema[col_name].dataType
                )
            )

        if df.select(F.min(col_name)).collect()[0][0] <= 0:
            raise ValueError("Log of Zero and negative numbers is not defined")

        df = df.withColumn(col_rename, F.log(F.col(col_name)))

        if not retain_original:
            df = df.drop(*[col_name])

        return df



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def reciprocal(df, col_name, **kwargs):
        """
        computes the reciprocal of a given column

        Args:
            df (PySpark DataFrame)
            col_name (string): column name

        Raises:
            exceptions.IncorrectDataTypeError: raised when datatype is not numeric
            ValueError: raised if negative values or zero is encountered

        Returns:
            PySpark DataFrame
        """
        # unpacking keyword args
        col_rename = kwargs.get("output_column_name", "{}_reciprocal".format(col_name))
        retain_original = kwargs.get("retain_original", True)

        if not isinstance(df.schema[col_name].dataType, (
            T.ByteType,
            T.ShortType,
            T.IntegerType,
            T.DoubleType,
            T.FloatType,
            T.LongType
        )):
            raise Exception(
                "Column {0} must be of type numeric but was actually of type {1}".format(
                    col_name, df.schema[col_name].dataType
                )
            )

        try:
            df = df.withColumn(col_rename, 1 / F.col(col_name))
        except ZeroDivisionError as E:
            raise ValueError("{}".format(E))

        if not retain_original:
            df = df.drop(*[col_name])

        return df




[docs]class StrTransforms(object):
    """    
    encloses all the numerical transforms
    """


[docs]    @staticmethod
    def string_indexer(df, col_name, **kwargs):
        """
        A label encoder that maps a string column to numeric labels
        """
        col_rename = kwargs.get("output_column_name", "{}_indexed".format(col_name))
        retain_original = kwargs.get("retain_original", True)
        indexer = StringIndexer(inputCol=col_name, outputCol=col_rename)
        indexed_df = indexer.fit(df).transform(df)

        if not retain_original:
            indexed_df = indexed_df.drop(*[col_name])

        return indexed_df



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def one_hot_encoder(df, col_list, **kwargs):
        """
        maps a column of category indices to a column of binary vectors

        Raises:
            exceptions.IncorrectDataTypeError: raised if any of the input columns is not of numeric dtype
        """
        for col_name in col_list:
            if not isinstance(df.schema[col_name].dataType, (T.IntegerType, T.DoubleType)):
                raise Exception(
                    "Column {0} must be of type numeric but was actually of type {1}".format(
                        col_name, df.schema[col_name].dataType
                    )
                )

        col_rename = kwargs.get("output_column_name")
        retain_original = kwargs.get("retain_original", True)
        encoder = OneHotEncoder(inputCols=col_list, outputCols=col_rename, dropLast=False)
        model = encoder.fit(df)
        encoded_df = model.transform(df)

        if not retain_original:
            encoded_df = encoded_df.drop(*col_list)

        return encoded_df



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def concat_columns(df, col_list, **kwargs):
        """
        concatenate two columns, using a delimiter (',' by default)
        """
        col_rename = kwargs.get("output_column_name", "_".join(col_list) + "_concat")
        retain_original = kwargs.get("retain_original", True)
        delimiter = kwargs.get("transformation_details", {"delimiter", ","})
        delimiter = delimiter["delimiter"]

        # create concat command
        concat_cmd = []
        for col in col_list:
            str_ = "F.col('{}')".format(col)
            concat_cmd.append(str_)

        concat_cmd_str = ",".join(concat_cmd)
        concat_cmd_str = "F.concat_ws('{0}', {1})".format(delimiter, concat_cmd_str)
        df = df.withColumn(col_rename, eval(concat_cmd_str))

        if not retain_original:
            df = df.drop(*col_list)

        return df



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def split_column(df, col_name, **kwargs):
        """
        split a column by a defined delimiter
        """
        col_rename = kwargs.get("output_column_name")
        retain_original = kwargs.get("retain_original", True)
        delimiter = kwargs.get("transformation_details")
        delimiter = delimiter["delimiter"]

        split_col = F.split(df[col_name], delimiter)
        df = df.withColumn(col_rename[0], split_col.getItem(0))
        df = df.withColumn(col_rename[1], split_col.getItem(1))

        if not retain_original:
            df = df.drop(*[col_name])

        return df



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def alter_case(df, col_name, case, **kwargs):
        """
        alters a string column to Uppercase or lowercase (decided by the case parameter)
        """
        retain_original = kwargs.get("retain_original", True)

        if case == "upper":
            col_rename = kwargs.get("output_column_name", "{}_uppercase".format(col_name))
            df = df.withColumn(col_rename, F.upper(F.col(col_name)))
        else:
            col_rename = kwargs.get("output_column_name", "{}_lowercase".format(col_name))
            df = df.withColumn(col_rename, F.lower(F.col(col_name)))

        if not retain_original:
            df = df.drop(*[col_name])

        return df



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def trim_whitespaces(df, col_name, **kwargs):
        """
        remove whitespaces
        """
        retain_original = kwargs.get("retain_original", True)
        col_rename = kwargs.get("output_column_name", "{}_trimmed".format(col_name))

        df = df.withColumn(col_rename, F.trim(F.col(col_name)))

        if not retain_original:
            df = df.drop(*[col_name])

        return df




[docs]class DateTimeTransform(object):
    """ """


[docs]    @staticmethod
    def convert_to_iso8601(df, col_name, is_epoch, **kwargs):
        """
        converts a string or epoch datetime to ISO-8601 format
        > Assumption - epoch should be upto second level (i.e. of 10 digits)

        Args:
            df (PySpark DataFrame)
            col_name (string): column name
            is_epoch (bool): if the input passed is of Unix epoch type or not

        Returns:
            PySpark DataFrame
        """
        retain_original = kwargs.get("retain_original", True)
        col_rename = kwargs.get("output_column_name", "{}_trimmed".format(col_name))

        if is_epoch:
            df = df.withColumn(col_rename, F.from_unixtime(df[col_name]))
            df = df.withColumn(col_rename, F.col(col_rename).cast("timestamp"))
        else:
            df = df.withColumn(col_rename, F.col(col_name).cast("timestamp"))

        if not retain_original:
            df = df.drop(*[col_name])

        return df




[docs]class Transformation(object):
    """performs columnar transformation on the Spark Database

        Args:
            df (spark.sql.DataFrame): Dataframe on which transformation operations are to be performed
            arguments (dict): 
    """
    def __init__(self, df, arguments):
        self.df = df
        self.transform_ops = arguments["transform_ops"]


[docs]    def execute(self):
        """
        driver method of Transformation

        Returns:
            PySpark DataFrame
        """
        self._execute()
        return self.df


    def _execute(self):
        """
        wrapper method
        """
        for transform_op in self.transform_ops:
            self.decode_transformation(transform_op)


[docs]    def decode_transformation(self, transform_op):
        """
        calls apt method for each transformation

        Args:
            transform_op (dict)
        """
        if Constants.operation_dict[transform_op["transformation"]] == "filter":
            F = Filter(
                self.df,
                transform_op["feature"][0],
                transform_op["rules"],
                transform_op["rule_expression"],
            )
            self.df = F.execute()
        elif Constants.operation_dict[transform_op["transformation"]] == "z-score":
            self.df = NumTransforms.zscore(
                self.df,
                transform_op["feature"][0],
                output_column_name=transform_op["output_column_name"],
                retain_original=transform_op["retain_original"],
            )
        elif Constants.operation_dict[transform_op["transformation"]] == "exp":
            self.df = NumTransforms.exp(
                self.df,
                transform_op["feature"][0],
                output_column_name=transform_op["output_column_name"],
                retain_original=transform_op["retain_original"],
            )
        elif Constants.operation_dict[transform_op["transformation"]] == "log":
            self.df = NumTransforms.log(
                self.df,
                transform_op["feature"][0],
                output_column_name=transform_op["output_column_name"],
                retain_original=transform_op["retain_original"],
            )
        elif Constants.operation_dict[transform_op["transformation"]] == "reciprocal":
            self.df = NumTransforms.reciprocal(
                self.df,
                transform_op["feature"][0],
                output_column_name=transform_op["output_column_name"],
                retain_original=transform_op["retain_original"],
            )
        elif Constants.operation_dict[transform_op["transformation"]] == "string-indexer":
            self.df = StrTransforms.string_indexer(
                self.df,
                transform_op["feature"][0],
                output_column_name=transform_op["output_column_name"],
                retain_original=transform_op["retain_original"],
            )
        elif Constants.operation_dict[transform_op["transformation"]] == "one-hot-encoding":
            self.df = StrTransforms.one_hot_encoder(
                self.df,
                transform_op["feature"],
                output_column_name=transform_op["output_column_name"],
                retain_original=transform_op["retain_original"],
            )
        elif Constants.operation_dict[transform_op["transformation"]] == "concat-with-delimiter":
            self.df = StrTransforms.concat_columns(
                self.df,
                transform_op["feature"],
                output_column_name=transform_op["output_column_name"],
                retain_original=transform_op["retain_original"],
                transformation_details=transform_op["transformation_details"],
            )
        elif Constants.operation_dict[transform_op["transformation"]] == "split":
            self.df = StrTransforms.split_column(
                self.df,
                transform_op["feature"][0],
                output_column_name=transform_op["output_column_name"],
                retain_original=transform_op["retain_original"],
                transformation_details=transform_op["transformation_details"],
            )
        elif Constants.operation_dict[transform_op["transformation"]] == "uppercase":
            self.df = StrTransforms.alter_case(
                self.df,
                transform_op["feature"][0],
                case="upper",
                output_column_name=transform_op["output_column_name"],
                retain_original=transform_op["retain_original"],
                transformation_details=transform_op["transformation_details"],
            )
        elif Constants.operation_dict[transform_op["transformation"]] == "lowercase":
            self.df = StrTransforms.alter_case(
                self.df,
                transform_op["feature"][0],
                case="lower",
                output_column_name=transform_op["output_column_name"],
                retain_original=transform_op["retain_original"],
                transformation_details=transform_op["transformation_details"],
            )
        elif Constants.operation_dict[transform_op["transformation"]] == "trim":
            self.df = StrTransforms.trim_whitespaces(
                self.df,
                transform_op["feature"][0],
                output_column_name=transform_op["output_column_name"],
                retain_original=transform_op["retain_original"],
                transformation_details=transform_op["transformation_details"],
            )
        elif Constants.operation_dict[transform_op["transformation"]] == "timestring-to-iso8601":
            self.df = DateTimeTransform.convert_to_iso8601(
                self.df,
                transform_op["feature"][0],
                is_epoch=False,
                output_column_name=transform_op["output_column_name"],
                retain_original=transform_op["retain_original"],
                transformation_details=transform_op["transformation_details"],
            )
        elif Constants.operation_dict[transform_op["transformation"]] == "epoch-to-iso8601":
            self.df = DateTimeTransform.convert_to_iso8601(
                self.df,
                transform_op["feature"][0],
                is_epoch=True,
                output_column_name=transform_op["output_column_name"],
                retain_original=transform_op["retain_original"],
                transformation_details=transform_op["transformation_details"],
            )
